TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Emily Perry, 05-16-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Mrs. James F. Perry, May 16, 1830. Glad that Perry is coming to Texas. Great field and future for men of education and talent. Removal of bodies of Mr. and Mrs. Moses Austin.

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Mrs. James F. Perry, May 16, 1830. Glad that Perry is coming to Texas. Great field and future for men of education and talent. Removal of bodies of Mr. and Mrs. Moses Austin.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-16-1830"> May 16, 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr. *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*I was most agreeably surprised indeed by meeting *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* who hunted me up in the *location_mentioned*Prairies */location_mentioned*where I was engaged in surveying the *location_mentioned*land which has been granted to him by this Govt. */location_mentioned*It appears to be a singular coinsidence, that he found me on the very spot where I presume we shall spend a large portion of the balance of our lives— he is delighted with the situation and I think you also will be it is on the *location_mentioned*bay*/location_mentioned*, and is a very handsome and I think healthy one— The *person_mentioned*boys */person_mentioned*can have their fill of fishing, and in the winter wild fowl are numerous tho. he will tell you all about it*/p*
*p*I have conversed with him relative to the removal of the bodies of our dear *person_mentioned*parents */person_mentioned*and I highly approve of their removal to a *location_mentioned*church yard*/location_mentioned*— I think that the best place will be the *location_mentioned*church yard at St Genivieve—*/location_mentioned* They were recognized under the *person_mentioned*Spanish Govt*/person_mentioned*, as *person_mentioned*Catholics */person_mentioned*and there cannot be any objection to receiving them there, or should the yard there be thrown open and uninclosed, I should be in favor of taking them to *location_mentioned*St Louis*/location_mentioned*, of this you and *person_mentioned*Mr P.*/person_mentioned* must be the judges but I am not in favor of taking them to *person_mentioned*Potosi */person_mentioned*for the reason that the *location_mentioned*burying grounds*/location_mentioned* there are all on *location_mentioned*private property*/location_mentioned* and may some day become *location_mentioned*common Fields*/location_mentioned*— I wish you would consult *person_mentioned*Mr Carr*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Elias Bates*/person_mentioned* on the subject and speak to *person_mentioned*F. Valle*/person_mentioned* relative to their admission into the *location_mentioned*Catholic burying ground at St. Genivieve*/location_mentioned* If they are taken to *location_mentioned*St Louis*/location_mentioned* I should prefer the Catholic to any other, but will leave that solely to you and *person_mentioned*Mr. Carr*/person_mentioned*, to do as you think proper I do not know in what *location_mentioned*burying ground*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Uncle and Aunt Elliott*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Mrs Carr*/person_mentioned* were buried, and if they were taken tó *location_mentioned*St Louis*/location_mentioned* I should wish if possible that they be placed*location_mentioned* by the side or near *person_mentioned*uncle and aunt Elliott*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Mrs Carr*/person_mentioned* I wish that a plain decent tomb stone be procured, If I should be in a situation to do it I will some day have a handsome monument erected *location_mentioned*over their graves—*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I am really happy at the idea of your leaving that *location_mentioned*cold region*/location_mentioned*, I look forward to many days of peace and enjoyment in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*— I hope in a few years to free myself from all my debts and to close my affairs here so that I may live a quiet and retired life in the society of my *person_mentioned*sister */person_mentioned*and her *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*— we must provide a *person_mentioned*teacher*/person_mentioned* to live in the *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*and educate them well— by the time they will be coming on to the *location_mentioned*Stage*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*will present a fine field for *person_mentioned*men of education and talents*/person_mentioned*— *person_mentioned*Mr P*/person_mentioned* will get Spanish bookes they all ought to learn that language*/p*
*p*I think that*person_mentioned* John Perry*/person_mentioned* might pass his life more agreeably in this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*or in *location_mentioned*Louisiana */location_mentioned*than in that *location_mentioned*cold region*/location_mentioned*. I should be happy to see him here, tho I cannot take on myself the responsibility of advising him to move for I presume he would wish to bring his *person_mentioned*Slaves*/person_mentioned*, and they could not be held as *person_mentioned*slaves */person_mentioned*by the laws now in force here—*/p*
*p*If *person_mentioned*Genl Hammond*/person_mentioned* wishes to come I will befriend him all in my power and assist him in getting *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*he would do very well here, by proper industry and econemy and provide a foundation in *location_mentioned*land*/location_mentioned* for the future settlement of his *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Bring all the papers and books of my *person_mentioned*Father */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Bryan's*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*Remember me to the *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned*, tell them to be attentive to their books and obedient to you and *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* and I will give the *person_mentioned*boys*/person_mentioned* ponies and a little boat, and something pritty to the *person_mentioned*Girls*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*I have seen your letter by *person_mentioned*Mr T. Browne */person_mentioned*and am glad that you have learned not to attend to reports and rumors if you suffer yourself to be made uneasy by them you will all the time be unhappy after you start to this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, for you will hear a great variety of them on the road and before you start*/p*
*p*remember me to *person_mentioned*Mrs John Perry*/person_mentioned* particularly and also to all my old *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*there— I will visit that place some day*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F, Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
